runs.comm: flights one on middle and off which is respected by the batsman
now drills this flatter one down to the man at long on
looks to guide away a single through the leg side, but can't get it away
simply comes down the track to lift the bowler over mid-off, before getting this away as the face opened over the deep extra-cover rope. Just trickled away over the boundary
now picks his spot over long on as he backed away a touch, slamming this one for a mighty 89m six. The man in the orange shirt tried to get it one-handed, but fails in the end
content to just finish off the over with a bunt on the leg side
back of a length which is crashed away through the covers, but not well enough for this to get to the rope
length delivery, outside of off, which is allowed to sail though to the keeper
short and pulled away emphatically through midwicket, placing this in front of square to find the boundary. They did win the 2012 World T20 championship. They will need plenty of that today
eases away this back of a length outside his off stump
now defended away off the back foot to the right of the bowler
shortish length, outside of off, which is fended away off the back foot
gets in a stride before playing this one drifted into him on the off side
now goes for the release shot as he sweeps away this one sliding on the pads, past the man at short backward square to find the boundary
flighted into the slot and Smith is simply able to loft this one elegantly over the long on boundary. Easy as you like really as he connected
slows this one in the air as it arrived to the batsman, with this neatly tucked away in the end on the leg side
now picks the single with this push towards the mid-off region

backs away a touch when he sees some width on the delivery. The fielder, running from extra-cover, is able to chase this down, but at the last stage falters as he put in the dive, with the ball already on the rope as he timed it

I better find some cover now from all the irate WI fans as Smith goes after this back of a length, going across him, which just straightens on him as he ends up feeding an inside-edge to the keeper behind. Snicko shows there was some contact there. Smith's indifferent World Cup campaign continues as he exits for 15
sensibly allows this fuller delivery to go across him as now there is now some doubt created after that last breakthrough
delivers a lovely, full, length which just nips away as Marlon squared up
gets the bat down to this short of a length, slanting across him
bowling a fantastic line and length here as Samuels is enticed to have a push when he saw the inviting length pitched up to him
gets over to the off side to see out this wicket maiden over from Guruge. Has been getting some lovely movement into the pads so far
fuller length, outside of off, which is struck away towards the mid-off region
drops it a touch short as Charles looked to pull this sweetly through midwicket, but ends up picking out the fielder on the ring
width and punished by Charles as he blazes away a cut through backward point to find the boundary in no time
now looks to force away a drive on the up through the covers, but ends up mistiming towards mid-on
short delivery, and wide, as Charles fails to mete the appropriate punishment

gets struck on the pads as he looked to glance this away, but the angle suggested this was going down leg. The captain and the bowler have a debate over it, before deciding at the last second to withdraw the appeal
continues bowling on a length, and across the batsman, as he goes for another play-and-a-miss outside his off stump
shoulders arms to this curler bowled across him. Guruge been given respect by the WI batsmen, so far
another length delivery with some appreciable inswing, as this is defended back to him
Guruge channeling his inner Akram as he delivers another length delivery, with this one bowled cross seam so it could slide across. Good variation there
gets bat to this sligthly short of a length, going across him, to work this away through third man as Guruge finally gets a run against his name

Charles decides the time for respect is over. Backs away a bit as this fullish length was delivered so he could get nicely under the line, and with the movement within, was able to launch this over the cow corner boundary for a flat six. Charles is keen to get a move on here
withdraws the bat to this shortish length outside his off stump
short of a length, angling in from wide of off, as this is dabbed down through third man for a single
works away this length delivery to the off side, but fails to pick any space
pitched up outside off as this is drilled away to the man on the ring at extra-cover
shortish length outside off which is bunted away to the off side
able to crash away this shortish length through sweeper cover, running the first one hard as they are able to hustle three in the end
Samuels shows his grace with this lovely timed push to this half-volley going across him. This one ends up racing straight back down the ground to the rope. Has looked a class above so far
sensibly allows this slightly back of a length delivery, going across him as the keeper collects from behind
now delivers a length delivery on the pads which Samuels fails to whip away

you just knew this was coming as Samuels looked a touch casual outside his off stump. Ends up slicing away this short of a length, going across once more, to the man at backward point, who is able to catch it at a very comfortable height. Guruge now has two as West Indies look for the quick runs
ends up getting away a leg bye, but not off the mark, as the unnecessary over throw behind square allows for the run to be taken
half-volley, just like the first delivery of the over, which is banished from Charles' presence as he leant into the drive through long off
drives this length delivery on middle and off firmly to the man at short cover
slipping down the leg side as this one got some away movement as it went down to the keeper
looks to pinpoint the gap between point and cover by opening the face to this drive, but ends up picking out point in the end
short of a length and angling in as this is fended away off the back foot
delivers a surprise shorter ball that goes across him at a nippy pace
covers the line nicely of this shortish length which bends in a bit upon pitching
wonderful drive through the mid-off region as he picked the gap in the ring to get away three runs in the end out at deep extra-cover

Carter gets away with this mis-timed chip to this length delivery coming into him, as Khurram Khan, at mid-on, had to run backward and then leap towards the ball, but was unable to get anything on it. Some luck there for WI
bowls a slightly back of a length now which slides into Carter's pads as he was late on the delivery
now goes for the risky slice over the gully fielder to pickup a single through third man. Not a very high percentage stroke there
back of a length, and width afforded, as Charles just caresses this sublimely off the back foot through the covers, as this raced away to the rope
checks his drive to this slower, length ball bowled across him. Ends up back at the bowler's feet
tries once more to go through the covers, but didn't quite get the timing on it
shortish length which is pulled away through midwicket, but not well enough to find the boundary

far too short now as Carter blasts away a pull to deep midwicket. The batsmen should have ran two there, but there were guilty of ball-watching as, despite the fumble and scramble for the ball in the deep by the fielder, they seemed content to just stroll the single
now slaps away this back of a length to the man on the ring at cover
Charles is looking, really, really good. Just class as he unfurls a drive on the up through extra-cover that beats the chasing fielder to the rope. Pure timing and balance from the right-hander
defends this short of a length angling into him from outside off

now picks the minute gap between the cover and point fielder, and just caresses this away, but the timing was so good that, after looking to be initially pulled up before the rope, this just seems to gather momentum over the final yards to beat the dive from the fielder
length delivery which straightens on him as Carter runs a single down through third man
short of a length, and going across, as this is just worked away off the back foot towards mid-off
backs away before tonking this back of a length over long off, but didn't quite time this as he did the earlier shots, as this one slows up in the deep
now flat-bats away this length delivery going across him to the man at long on
defended by the batsman on the off side
slower delivery which is dabbed down to third man as Carter keeps the strike
looks to be aggressive from the get go, but mistimes the drive over to the leg side
fails to force away a stroke through the covers
slides one down the pads which Carter is able to sweep successfully round the corner to beat the short fine leg inside of the ring
loopy delivery on middle which is blitzed away through the covers. This traveled at a rate of knots to the extra-cover rope
another flighted delivery which should have been punished through the leg side, but ends up being struck back to the bowler in his follow through
goes over the wicket now as Charles eases away the UAE captain through midwicket
given width outside his off stump as he slaps this away to sweeper cover
punches back this back of a length to the bowler in his follow through
short of a length which is played back to Manjula. Good change-up there as he took off the pace
slower, back of a length which is pinged down long off as the pair run a brace so Charles could reach a well-deserved third ODI fifty. Needs to press on though
hones on the middle stump with this attempted yorker, with Charles clipping away to the close-in fielder on the leg side
short and given room to free his arms as he utilises the angle well to scythe this through third man for four more
steers away this floated delivery on middle and leg to midwicket
sliding down the pads as Charles tried to help it round the corner, but the leg slip is all over this
now cuts away just outside off to get to the other end in a hurry
flighted on middle and off as this is just smoked through the covers, but all along the ground, as the man coming from sweeper cover didn't stand a chance

slides one onto the pads which Carter was late on as he looked for the dab. The extra bounce did him in there. Tauqir wants the review though as the batsmen ran the leg byes. The ball appears to have flicked the top of the back pad. Impact is umpire's call though, so because the original decision was given not out, it will stay that way. Lucky break for WI though.
now pushes this one off the back foot to the leg side to end an eventful over
begins with a length delivery, well wide of off, which is left alone by Charles
length delivery which Charles looked to bludgeon over his head, but ends up getting a top-edge which flies high to the fielder at mid-on, with Krishna getting under it comfortably in the end
Carter attempts to slam this through the long on area, but fails to get it away
gets this one to nip away after pitching back of a length on off, with Carter looking to jab it away through the covers
pitches it up now in the same channel as Carter fails to get away the off drive

there was a wonderful sound as he connected with this short ball, but ends up spooning high over long on, with the ball just stopping a few feet after landing. Lucky that did not go up near any fielders though
gets on the front foot to defend this one drifting onto off stump
gives respect to this flighted ball on and around off and turning in
gets deep in his crease to try and manipulate this ball through mid-on, but fails to achieve the result
able to get nicely under this tossed up delivery as he wallops this well over the cow corner boundary for a huge six
slides in a quicker one which is turned away to short backward square
shuffles over to the leg side before punching this away to long off to end the over
gets nicely behind the line of this back of a length on middle and leg

Javed has done the trick once more as Russell mistimes this attempted swat over long on, getting this to spoon high over to the bowler, who had to move just a couple of yards to his left to get under it. Disappointing from Russell as WI go four down now in chase of these runs
off the mark straight away as he places this whip off the hips behind of square to pickup two
tries to ease away a run on the leg side, but the close-in fielder kept him honest
on the front foot as this one is defended softly on the leg side
fuller delivery, on the pads, which is clipped away straight to short mid-on
starts from round the wicket as he floats this one outside off, which is driven firmly through the covers to beat the converging fielder from sweeper cover
now threads away a single towards deep extra-cover
flighted in on middle and off as this is tucked away towards mid-on
driven back to the bowler in his follow through
content to just defend away this floater on middle and off
fails to get away a run through mid-on as the over comes to a close
delivers a length ball on the pads which Carter fails to get away with a clip
gets this one to just nip away as it went across, with Carter playing inside of the line
another one on the pads which Carter fails to get away

back of a length delivery, angled across off. Carter looks to tuck it away into the on side, but closes the bat face early, with the leading edge popping up to the right of the bowler, but this ends up rolling away through mid-off in the end
short of a length which is run down through third man

fuller delivery, outside of off, which is struck away to mid-on as Ramdin immediately sped to the other end. Mid-on is able to pick this up and fire in a shy at the non-striker's, and does connect, but Ramdin was quite comfortably in
able to tuck away this slider through midwicket, with the fumble from the fielder affording them the extra run
driven back to the bowler in his follow through
flighted up on off stump as this is drilled back to the bowler
onto the front foot as this is defended away by the batsman
now gets away a steer through long on to get off the strike

almost gets this one to slide onto the stumps from round the wicket as Carter played off the back foot, with this one almost bursting through to knock back off. Should have gone forward to the delivery, but he survives.
fires in a yorker on middle and off which is dug away by the batsman on the leg side
width afforded and Ramdin is able to punish this poor delivery with an emphatic cut behind of square to find the boundary
able to tuck away a single down to long on, with the intention of getting back for the second, which the pair are able to do
now driven away off the back foot to the man at deep cover
fuller length on and around off which is struck away towards the mid-on region
slips a leg-side delivery which brushes the pad of Ramdin as he failed to get away the flick
misfield at mid-off which allows for this drive to get down to long off, and more importantly, rotate the strike
flights one on middle which is struck away to the bowler in his follow through
now picks up a single through the cover region to get Carter on strike
gets deep in the crease before punching away this one sliding on middle and leg towards long on
defends this one drifting in on middle and leg
now clips away firmly to deep midwicket to retain the strike
another noise as this one went down the leg side, with Ramdin looking to get away the flick. The umpire did not seem interested though as Amjad pleaded to get a third
on the back foot as this one is fended away to the leg side
defends away this back of a length to the bowler on his right
gets away the dab-and-run outside of off as the bowler and keeper reacted a bit late
bangs in a bouncer which Carter wasn't even in the same hemisphere of
drills this length delivery going across, but finds the close-in fielder on the off side
whips away a single through midwicket now as the runs required become just 33
tries to cut this away past the man at backward point, but fails to do so
flighted well wide of off as Carter is able to loft this over deep extra-cover to get to the boundary. Bad ball which just had to be punished in the end

now slides one in on the pads as they are able to complete three runs through long on, when there should have been only one. Aggressive running, coupled with the misfield in the deep, made that possible
tosses one up around the feet of the batsman as this is clipped away quite comfortably square off the wicket
fends away this tossed up delivery on middle and leg
eases away a run down to long on as West Indies need just 24 more now
bowls a back of a length from round the wicket which angles into him. Defended in the end by Carter
another shortish length which this time is shouldered arms to, as this angled in outside off
fuller delivery, outside off, which is driven firmly to the close-in fielder on the off side
given some width to this back of a length delivery from Amjad as he drove away through point, with the fielder at backward point moving well to his left to take off most of the pace
full delivery, just outside off, which is dug away to the leg side
play-and-miss outside his off stump to this angled length delivery from round the wicket
begins his spell with a shortish delivery, wide of off, which he tried to scythe away through point, but ends up picking the fielder
gets this one to seam in from outside off after being delivered on a back of a length
looks to force away a drive now through long off, but picks out mid-off
short of a length which is placed away behind of square as the batsmen run two
tucks away a single on the leg side as the batsmen rotate strike
short of a length which is pulled away towards the mid-on region

able to open the face and run this length delivery through third man, with the batsmen looking to get as many as possible as the throw from the deep almost has Ramdin run out as he attempted to make his ground at the striker's end
fullish length, outside off, which is drilled to the cover fielder
now straying down the pads as this is flicked away with ease through backward square. Poor ball from Amjad
elects to go shorter now, with this hooked away with the leg-side slant on offer
goes round the wicket now as this length delivery, wide of off, is driven firmly to deep extra-cover by Carter
short ball, outside of off, as the leg umpire makes his presence known with a signal to the scorers
hooks away this shortish length through fine leg as Ramdin keeps the strike
begins with a length delivery, going across the batsman, as this is just defended away on the off side
now drives away through the covers, but is held by the man in the ring
pushes hard for two as he clips away this delivery square off the wicket on the leg side. Brings up their fifty-run stand as well
tries to get away a single on the leg side, but picks out the close-in fielder instead
length delivery on leg which is tucked away behind of square
now dabs away a run through third man to end the over
gets nicely behind the line of this Amjad special on middle and leg
fires in a full, slower delivery which Carter tried to glide away through third man, but fails to get to the ball
gets low to this fullish length going across, before angling it away through third man to raise his fifty. Has been such a crucial knock, along with Charles' effort, to get WI to this point
content to fend away this fullish length outside off stump
fuller length, on middle and leg, which is eased down to long on
offers a full toss which should have been creamed away to end the over, but instead Ramdin just pokes it away to sweeper cover
able to clip away this fuller length on the pads through fine leg to level the scores
drives away this length delivery towards the off side, but fails to get the needed single
Ramdin able to end this with a heave over towards midwicket as West Indies successfully complete their mission here in Napier
